external_links.text: Beef, Bison, and Veal Carcass Grade Requirements - PDF (260 kb)
external_links.context: Veal sold at retail must be labelled in accordance with the definition of veal in the Beef, Bison, and Veal Carcass Grade Requirements - PDF (260 kb) document, as outlined in the Common name â€“ meat and poultry products section.

Products with a scale label can display the symbol as a separate sticker or printed directly on the scale label. In addition, some flexibility applies to the location of the nutrition symbol for these products. For more information, refer to Products with a scale label .

external_links.text: What is the symbol size based on?
external_links.context: Prepackaged products with a principal display surface (PDS) > 250 cm 2 that are sold only in the retail establishment where they are packaged and labelled by means of a sticker can carry a smaller symbol than would otherwise be required [B.01.352(2), FDR]. For more information, refer to section What is the symbol size based on? in the Front-of-package nutrition symbol labelling guide for industry.
